Twin tropical storms threaten flooding, mudslides in Taiwan and Vietnam
Vietnam and Taiwan are bracing for twin tropical storms which are expected to make landfall over the coming days, with typhoon Chanthu strengthening into a Super Typhoon in the past 24 hours.
World
8 min ago
US cities are losing 36 million trees a year. Here is why it matters

If you are looking for a reason to care about tree loss, this summers record-breaking heat waves might be it. Trees can lower summer daytime temperatures by as much as 10 degrees Fahrenheit, according to a recent study.
Climate in crisis

Photographic proof that wild animals are hilarious
The selection of 42 images make up the final shortlist for the competition, which received more than 7,000 entries from around the world, according to a press release on Wednesday.

25 min ago
There\'s a shortage of truckers, but TuSimple thinks it has a solution: no driver needed
Right now, there\'s a shortage of truck drivers in the US and worldwide, exacerbated by the e-commerce boom brought on by the pandemic.
Fish
Other
33 min ago
A newly discovered dinosaur with shark-like teeth was the T. rex of its day

It belongs to family of dinosaurs known as carcharodontosaurs, best known for their shark-like teeth. Named Ulughbegsaurus uzbekistanensis, it was at least 22 feet (seven meters) long and weighed more than a ton (1,000 kilograms) and would have roamed Central Asia about 90 million years ago.
Business
44 min ago
The pandemic changed the way we work. 15 CEOs weigh in on what\'s next

The shutdowns caused by the Covid-19 pandemic forced Corporate America to embark upon a massive work-from-home experiment that presented many unknowns: How do we keep workers safe? Can we stay productive? What’s the best way to communicate and collaborate? How long will we be out of the office?
